term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - flame photometric detector in gas chromatography
term.title: flame photometric detector

item.text: The eluent from the column is fed into a hydrogen-rich flame and produces light emission. Optical filters are used to select the wavelength range of the emission which is characteristic of specific atoms (usually sulfur or phosphorus). The detector is very specific, depending on the choice of optical filters. It can detect the S- and P-containing compounds down to 10E-3 ppmv, but the detector is non-linear.
